Toast the Twilight at Early Mountain! ‚Å†
‚Å†What could be better than summer sunsets in the Meadow? Beginning July 1st, we will be open from 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. every Friday for the month of July. The Meadow menu, as well as the walk-up bar, will be available into the evening for a casual summertime Early Mountain experience. Chef Tim will also be serving his famous Fried Chicken and other special accompanying dishes all day. ‚Å†üç∑

‚ú®New Release‚ú®‚Å†
‚Å† 2021 Five Forks is now available. This beautiful summer sipper is sure to bring everyone to the table. With Petit Manseng in the lead, we feel the intensity and texture that are inherent to this grape. The aromatics flow from pear to peach to mango and are repeated as flavors on the palate, where the Sauvignon Blanc steps in with snappy green flavors, both herbs and piquant orchard fruit, and adds acid precision and a mineral finish. ‚Å†
‚Å†

On this #NationalWineDay we are celebrating the innovation and bright future of Virginia wine. 

Maya fell in love with Virginia wine and the cutting-edge agricultural practices required in Virginia‚Äôs unpredictable winemaking conditions. We are thrilled to have such vision and talent at the helm of our wine-growing innovations. ‚Å†

 ‚ÄúWhile I never planned to stay in Virginia wine country, the opportunity at Early Mountain to farm extraordinary vineyard sites like Quaker Run, while also being supported to use innovation and cutting-edge agricultural practices to respond to ever-changing vintages, really drew me in. The ability to engage deeply in both viticulture and winemaking kept me here and I am fully sold on the bright future for Virginia wine.‚Äù‚Å†

Read more about Maya with the link in our bio and happy National Wine Day! ü•Ç

Bar Tastings are back! ‚Å†
‚Å†This walk-in experience is the perfect opportunity to learn our portfolio and ask questions about our winemaking and vineyards. Join us at the bar to enjoy a tasting of 6 hand-selected wines led by one of our wine educators. ‚Å†
‚Å†
Bar Tastings will be offered weekdays, Thursday, Friday and Monday. Wine Club Members receive one free tasting with each visit! ‚Å†
‚Å†
Wine Flights will continue to be available for tableside tastings. Our Elevation Tastings are also available for a more in-depth bespoke, seated experience with library wines and a culinary component. ‚Å†

Calling all Virginia wine lovers in NYC! Join us TUESDAY for a casual Virginia wine hang at Temperance Wine Bar in Greenwich Village. FIVE Virginia winemakers will be on-hand (including our very own Maya Hood White and Ben Jordan)with an assortment of delicious #vawine available By the Glass! *OPEN TO ALL*... consumers, friends, trade! 

Tuesday, May 3rd, 6 - 10 pm or until the wines last! Coming with a group? Make sure to reserve a table @resy. 

Thanks to @ajojedapons for welcoming us! 

Featured winemakers-
Kirsty Harmon @blenheimvineyards
Maya Hood White @earlymountain
Ben Jordan @lightwellsurvey
Luca Paschina @barboursville
Matthieu Finot @domainefinotva

The vineyards are bursting with new life and our crew is now on regular frost watch, ensuring that the young buds are protected from any cool temps. ‚Å†
‚Å†
We had some dips to 28F last night with unusually still air. Our wind turbines, strategically placed throughout the vineyards, were crucial and drew warmer air down around the vines. It‚Äôs a bit early to assess fully, but our vineyard team isn‚Äôt seeing any major damage and are quite thankful. Cheers to the start of vintage 2022!‚Å†
